The Dow Jones Industrial Average erased gains to end flat in today's stock market, while the major indexes sold off in afternoon trading. The S&P 500 and Nasdaq composite both reversed lower.

articles.title: 60 largest banks in the world have invested $3.8 trillion in fossil fuels since the Paris Agreement - CNBC
articles.description: A new report from a collection of climate organizations finds 60 of the world's largest banks have  put $3.8 trillion into fossil fuels from 2016 to 2020.
articles.content:
Major banks around the world are still financing fossil fuel companies to the tune of trillions of dollars.
